results.description: Highlights of the final weekend of 2019 Women's Six Nations - England v Scotland, Wales v Ireland and Italy v France.

results.description: Wales ensure they end their Six Nations campaigns with back-to-back victories by overcoming Ireland at Cardiff Arms Park.

results.description: England women's head coach Simon Middleton says his side had to put on a show for a record Twickenham crowd in their 12-try demolition of Scotland.
results.shortTitle: England must 'win in a certain way'
results.title: Women's Six Nations: England had to put on a show for record crowd

results.description: Shade Munro will leave his role as Scotland Women's head coach to take up a new post within Scottish Rugby.

results.title: Shade Munro: Scotland Women's head coach to leave role

results.description: England run in 12 tries in thrashing Scotland to seal a ninth Grand Slam and regain the Six Nations title.

results.title: England 80-0 Scotland: Red Roses win Grand Slam and regain Women's Six Nations

thumbnail.altText: England celebrate

results.description: Watch highlights as England run in 12 tries, averaging a point a minute, as they thrash Scotland 80-0 at Twickenham to seal another Six Nations Grand Slam.
results.shortTitle: Highlights: England thrash Scotland to seal Grand Slam
results.title: Women's Six Nations: England thrash Scotland to seal Grand Slam

thumbnail.altText: England's Emily Scarratt

results.description: England score nine tries to all but reclaim the Women's Six Nations title with a crushing 55-0 victory over Italy in Exeter.

results.title: England beat Italy 55-0 to maintain Six Nations Grand Slam title hopes

thumbnail.altText: England players thank the crowd

results.description: France move into second place in the Women's Six Nations table with a seven-try 47-17 victory over Ireland at Donnybrook.

results.description: Wales' Siwan Lillicrap scores a last-minute try, converted by Lleucu George, to give Wales a 17-15 win, and leave Scotland without a 2019 Women's Six Nations victory.
